arm_group.description: Artificial tears eye drops QID for 1 month

brief_summary.textblock:
Research indicates that many people who are being treated for glaucoma have dry eyes. The
      purpose of this study is to test the use of artificial tears to alleviate dryness signs and
      symptoms in people who are using medication to treat glaucoma. The study hypothesis is that
      the use of artificial tears will result in an improvement in clinical signs and symptoms
      associated with dry eyes.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study on the Use of Artificial Tears to Treat Dry Eye in Glaucoma Patients

facility.name: Centre for Contact Lens Research, University of Waterloo

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study on the Use of Artificial Tears to Treat Dry Eye in Glaucoma Patients

other_outcome.description: Participants will complete a standardized grading scales regarding their subjective ratings of comfort, dryness, burning and redness and comparisons will be made between the scores after 1 week and 1 month of artificial tear use with the baseline score.
other_outcome.measure: Subjective ratings of comfort, dryness, burning and redness
other_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (dispensing visit) and 1 week and 1 month after using artificial tears

primary_outcome.description: Corneal and conjunctival staining will be assessed using slit lamp biomicroscopy.
The time taken for the tear film to break up on the surface of the cornea will be measured using slit lamp biomicroscopy following fluorescein instillation .
primary_outcome.measure: Tear break up time with fluorescein

primary_outcome.description: Corneal and conjunctival staining will be assessed using slit lamp biomicroscopy.
The time taken for the tear film to break up on the surface of the cornea will be measured using slit lamp biomicroscopy following fluorescein instillation .
primary_outcome.measure: Tear break up time with fluorescein

primary_outcome.description: Corneal and conjunctival staining will be assessed using slit lamp biomicroscopy.
The time taken for the tear film to break up on the surface of the cornea will be measured using slit lamp biomicroscopy following fluorescein instillation .
primary_outcome.measure: Tear break up time with fluorescein

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a standardized questionnaire regarding their symptoms of dry eyes and comparisons will be made between the scores after 1 week and 1 month of artificial tear use with the baseline score.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (dispensing visit) and 1 week and 1 month after using artificial tears

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
